title: Understanding Memory Function Differences Across the Lifespan and Applying Mnemonic Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational cognitive psychology knowledge and educational field experience
context.additional_context: Targeting adult learners in their 30s, focusing on analyzing life-stage memory mechanisms and designing mnemonic training programs applicable in educational settings, including digital device-based practical activities

learning_goals: Learners can explain developmental differences in associative and strategic memory components across the lifespan.
Learners can apply mnemonic techniques (e.g., storytelling, visualization) to strengthen associative memory components in real educational contexts.
Learners can integrate metacognitive support strategies into project-based assessments to develop strategic memory components.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
